item.title: For Gen Z, it’s ‘not enough to work hard’ if you want to succeed, says Jamie Dimon—specific skills are the way to get ahead
item.description: "In the old days, you could be in 10th grade, go get a factory in Detroit, and eventually you could afford a family, a home, a car, and that may not b...

item.title: Trump admits the GOP was blindsided by economy fears as Democrats sweep key races: ‘Republicans don’t talk about the word affordability’
item.description: "We have the greatest economy right now. A lot of people don’t see that," Trump said.

item.title: The pope hates it. Norway hates it. Elon Musk calls them ‘corporate terrorists.’ Welcome to Tesla’s trillion-dollar showdown
item.description: “He frequently teeters on the edge of disaster," said Tesla owner and money manager Nancy Tengler, "and then pulls back just in the nick of time.”

item.title: The ‘bike bus’ movement has taken over one New Jersey town, with hundreds biking to school each day: ‘People naturally gravitate to something that’s super joyful’
item.description: What began as a handful of parents hoping to encourage their kids to bike to school has grown into a weekly ritual for the township.

item.title: Anxious generation author warns Gen z’s brains are ‘growing around their phones’ the way a tree warps around a tombstone
item.description: Speaking at a Dartmouth symposium on mental health, NYU professor Jonathan Haidt discussed his research on “the Great Rewiring.”
